title: El Mercado de los Sueños
description: A magical story about Isabella, a dream merchant who navigates a mysterious market where people's lost dreams are traded and sold.

chapters.title: The Discovery
chapters.description: Isabella's first encounter with the dream market and meeting Don Miguel

sentences.Me quedé dormida en mi tienda, como much: I fell asleep in my shop, as I often did, and suddenly, I wasn't there.
sentences.Un espacio vasto, velado por una luz ten: A vast space, veiled by a dim light that seemed to come from nowhere, and the air vibrated with an unknown energy.

sentences.Podía sentir sus historias, sus emocione: I could feel their stories, their emotions, as if they were distant echoes in my own mind.
sentences.\"Bienvenida, Isabella,\" una voz profun: "Welcome, Isabella," a deep, warm voice broke the ethereal silence.

sentences.Llevaba una túnica sencilla y sostenía u: He wore a simple tunic and held a staff that seemed to be made of moonlight.

chapters.title: Moon, The Lost Dream
chapters.description: Isabella learns about her role as a dream merchant and her first mission

sentences.Don Miguel me guio a través de los puest: Don Miguel guided me through the vibrant stalls, whispering market secrets to me.
sentences.\"Aquí, Isabella,\" dijo su voz amable,: "Here, Isabella," his kind voice said, "dreams aren't bought with coins, but with intentions and hopes.
sentences.Cada sueño tiene una energía, una histor: Every dream has an energy, a story." I learned that the brightest dreams were those newly lost or newly sought, full of life and promises.
sentences.Pero también vi otros, más tenues, que f: But I also saw others, more faint, that drifted aimlessly, awaiting a destiny.

sentences.Es encontrar el camino de regreso para a: It's about finding the way back for those that have strayed." His gaze gave me strength.
